channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Is Princeton Clamping Down on Recording On-Campus Events?
item.description: The timing of these new rules is rather suspicious.

item.title: Creedalism Needs Culture
item.description: When it comes to American identity, creedalism and culture aren’t mutually exclusive. Indeed, they must be melded.

item.title: The U.K.’s About-Face on Puberty Blockers for Children
item.description: A new major clinical trial exposing minors to puberty suppression represents an indefensible course change for the U.K.

item.title: 10 Tips To Keep Smartphones From Making Your Kids Tired, Fat, And Miserable
item.description: A new study serves as a sobering warning to parents to avoid giving smartphones to their kids until absolutely necessary.

item.title: Wisconsin’s Lib-Led Supreme Court Stacks The Congressional Map Deck
item.description: The latest leftist gerrymander stunt should serve as a reminder to Republicans that failure to rewrite representation lines is not an option.

item.title: SCOTUS Signals Willingness To Side With Trump Admin In Asylum Cases Dispute
item.description: 'It seems to me a prototypical case for the [Board of Immigration Appeals],' said Chief Justice Roberts.

item.title: Appeals Court: Alina Habba May Not Serve as De Facto U.S. Attorney
item.description: Trump and Bondi’s finagling with the appointment process has gotten them nowhere.

item.title: No, Trump Is Not to Blame for the National Guard Shooting
item.description: The reaction in the media to this attack is as predictable as it is revolting.

item.title: 2 conservative operatives get probation for robocalls to discourage Black Detroit voters in 2020
item.description: Two conservative political operatives were sentenced to probation Monday for a scheme to discourage Black Detroit voters from voting by mail in the 20...

item.title: GOP-led states settle lawsuit against federal government over checking citizenship status of voters
item.description: Four Republican-led states agreed to settle lawsuits against the federal government over access to voters' citizenship data, ending a dispute that beg...

item.title: New Docs Reveal Jack Smith Intentionally Violated Congressional Republicans’ Constitutional Rights
item.description: Smith never should have approved the subpoenas since they violated the congressional Republicans’ clearly established rights.

item.title: Kelly says Pentagon hasn't notified him of potential court-martial, other than Hegseth's post
item.description: Sen. Mark Kelly said Monday that he's not received formal notification from the Defense Department about being recalled to active-duty status so he ca...

item.title: Claims Afghans Were ‘Vetted’ Contradict Federal Investigations And Common Sense
item.description: The process by which the Biden administration ushered Afghans into the United States barely resembles 'vetting' at all.

item.title: Gerrymandering is spreading across U.S. states after Trump pushed for new congressional districts
